section.title: Overview
section.para: Pardus &PRODVER; contains major improvements over the previous Pardus release &PREVVER;. The following sections provide a brief overview of those changes.

section.title: Hardware Overview
section.para: Pardus &PRODVER; now supports 64-bit processor architecture which is supported by many new Intel and AMD processors.

listitem.para: Kernel - The latest Linux kernel &KERNELVER; provides an up-to-date hardware support together with a thousand of bug fixes.
Plymouth - The bootsplash technology used in Pardus &PREVVER; is updated to its latest version for a much stable experience.
YALI - YALI, the installer of Pardus, gained LVM/RAID and UUID support.

KDE SC - Pardus &PRODVER; comes with the latest KDE Software Compilation, KDE SC &KDEVER;. The base packages also contains numerous backports and fixes which will improve the stability of your desktop experience significantly.
Kaptan - Kaptan, the desktop customization tool of Pardus, now optionally captures your picture and sets it as your avatar in KDE.

NetworkManager - GNOME NetworkManager &NMVER; is now the default networking backend in Pardus &PRODVER;. Users are now able to set up their HSPA/CDMA/VPN networks together with the already supported Ethernet and 802.11 WLAN networks.
GTK Oxygen style - All GTK applications are now rendered with Oxygen style thanks to the oxygen-gtk project. This brings a huge improvement to the user interface consistency.
LibreOffice - LibreOffice, an Open Source personal productivity suite sponsored by the Document Foundation, is now the default Office Suite in Pardus &PRODVER;.
